newsitem.title: MEXICO: Bufete head sees CFE payments deal soon.
newsitem.headline: Bufete head sees CFE payments deal soon.

text.p: Bufete Industrial Chairman Jose Mendoza Fernandez he expected Mexico's Federal Electricity Commission (CFE) to agree on the amount it owes as accounts receivable by the end of 1996.

The negotiations "are on the right track. We hope this problem can be resolved this very year," he said in a recent Reuters interview, though he added that any payment to Bufete may not be made until later.
The CFE, which is state-owned, held back on some payments owed to Bufete that analysts say has hit the construction and engineering firm's bottom line.
Mendoza said the company would not finalize its financing plans going forward until the negotiations with the CFE are completed. He refused to say how much money was involved in the talks.

"Fortunately, I believe that this will be resolved before the end of the year, we hope...that will give us a very clear idea of the panorama and what we have to do (in terms of obtaining financing)," he said.
